goal.ch: 2021-2030年是聯合國海洋永續發展的關鍵十年，本課程將讓學生了解到基礎的海洋物理及海洋化學知識，讓學生足夠理解全球海洋的性質和特徵。海洋學是一門科學，專注於解釋水在地球各個部分發生的所有物理和生物化學過程。描述性海洋學描述了海洋中水團的分佈和特徵和研究海洋中水的運動及其運動原因的部分；化學海洋學負責研究海水化學成分的部分及分析人類活動的排放而產生的水的化學組成發生的所有變化。本課程內容包括海洋地理、海洋循環、海洋數據分析及方法、大氣化學、海洋營養鹽及初級生產力、太平洋、印度洋及大西洋的水體詳細特徵。(本課程不限任何科系背景，歡迎大學部選修)
goal.en: Oceanography is the general name given to the scientific study of the oceans. It is historically divided into physical, biological, chemical, and geological oceanography. The basic goal of oceanography is to obtain a clear and systematic description of the oceans. It is hoped that an increased knowledge of the oceans will lead to a better understanding of how they control the climate of the earth and how they can be used as a source of food, chemicals, and energy. This course is concerned primarily with the physics and chemistry of the ocean. Descriptive oceanography approaches the ocean through both observations and complex numerical model output used to describe the fluid motions as quantitatively as possible. It is important to understand these descriptive features since the movement of ocean waters affects the biogeochemical processes that occur in the oceans.(This course is not limited to any academic background, welcome to undergraduate student)
